events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on the evening of April 30th. They provided initial details about the accident involving their vehicle.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the mention of vehicle collision and damages related to the insured car.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the case and to guide the customer through the claims process after receiving initial documentation.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that their case would be processed promptly.
Additional documents were requested from the customer, including the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates.
Customer submitted all requested documents in a timely manner, including the detailed police report and multiple images clearly showing the extent of the car damage.
The claims department began their formal investigation to assess liability and verify the details provided about the vehicle collision incident.
Investigation concluded confirming the customer’s claim was valid with clear evidence supporting the extent of damage and responsibility assigned to the other party.
A settlement offer was sent to the customer outlining the compensation amount calculated based on repair costs and valuation of the vehicle post-accident.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the insurer’s timely handling of the auto accident claim.
The claim approval was finalized confirming the agreed settlement and confirming that funds would be disbursed shortly to cover vehicle repairs.
The settlement payment has been transferred to the customer’s account, enabling them to proceed with the repairs at their chosen service center.
After confirmation that the repairs were completed and no further issues arose, the insurance claim was officially closed with no outstanding actions.
The entire case file and all related documents were archived securely as per company protocol for future reference if needed.
